Articles.Content:
I discovered KSP earlier this year from reading an article about Elon Musk where he endorsed the space flight simulation software. I have been hooked ever since! I have already started working on my first addon (about a month into it) which I hope to be able to share with all y'all if I get it to the point that it would be cool enough to share. I am an astrophysicist by training, so the mod I am working on is geared towards that. This forum has helped me quite a bit so far, so I thought it would be a good time to sign up, got a few questions that I haven't been able to find answers to quite yet.

Happy modding!
Welcome aboard! If you're an astrophysicist, let me point you to eggrobin's [Principia mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68502), an implementation of n-body physics in KSP.

Welcome aboard! Astrophysics sure is exciting, I'm hoping to become a physics teacher one day. Maybe if I can get my math grades up... ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
Hi Red Iron Crown, thanks for pointing that out, getting Lagrange points working is a nice addition!
